name: Khas-Arya
description: Traditional 'high castes' from the hills, including Brahmin (Bahun), Chhetri, Thakuri, and Sanyasi/Dashnami. Historically dominant in politics, administration, and considered 'twice-born' (tagadhari) in the Hindu system.
notes: Dominant in civil service and education historically.

name: Adivasi Janajati (Indigenous Nationalities)
description: Broad category of indigenous ethnic groups, mostly Tibeto-Burman origin. Divided by geography and culture; officially recognized as 59+ groups.
notes: Includes groups like Gurung, Magar, Tamang, Rai, Limbu, Tharu, etc. Many claim higher actual percentage.

name: Madhesi (Tarai Caste Group)
description: Caste-origin communities from the southern plains (Terai) with cultural/linguistic ties to northern India. Includes high, middle, and lower castes.
notes: Languages: Maithili, Bhojpuri, Awadhi, etc. Significant in Terai politics.

name: Dalit
description: Historically marginalized 'untouchable' occupational castes facing severe discrimination. Divided by region.
notes: Includes Kami, Damai, Sarki (Hill); Chamar, Musahar, Dom (Tarai). Lowest in socio-economic indicators.

name: Newar
description: Indigenous people of the Kathmandu Valley with unique, complex Hindu-Buddhist social structure and castes/sub-castes.
notes: Own language (Nepal Bhasa), culture, and architecture. Sometimes grouped separately from Janajati.

name: Muslims
description: Religious minority with communities in both hills and Terai. Distinct cultural and religious identity.
notes: Classified separately in censuses; includes various sub-groups.

name: Other Social Groups
description: Smaller communities with foreign ancestry or other minorities, such as Marwadi, Bengali, Punjabi, etc.
